meanings.definition: The boundary line formed by a fence.
meanings.sent1: The cows grazed peacefully along the fencelines.
meanings.sent2: The property was divided by sturdy fencelines.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog tried to jump over the fencelines but got stuck.
meanings.sent4: The fencelines between the neighbors' yards symbolized their shared responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The old wooden fencelines creaked in the wind, telling stories of the past.

meanings.definition: To mark or protect with a fence.
meanings.sent1: The farmer decided to fenceline his entire property to keep the animals safe.
meanings.sent2: They fencelined the garden to keep out the rabbits.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to fenceline their imaginary castle with sticks.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to fenceline her heart after being hurt so many times.
meanings.sent5: The security guard fencelined the perimeter to ensure no one could enter unauthorized.

meanings.sent1: Wildflowers bloomed beautifully along the fencelines.
meanings.sent2: The children found a lost ball near the fencelines.
meanings.sent3: The cat loved to walk along the fencelines and chase butterflies.
meanings.sent4: The fencelines were covered with ivy, creating a natural border.
meanings.sent5: The fencelines marked the edge of the property, separating it from the forest.
